channel.title: Design - Digg
channel.description: Design on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Watch An Animatronics Engineer Create A Giant, 3D-Printed LEGO Go-Kart
item.description: To create a giant Go-Kart he could potentially sit on and steer, engineer Matt Denton 3D-printed LEGO parts 8.3 times larger than a real LEGO car.

item.title: I Sampled My Way Through The Wild World Of High-End Cannabis Products
item.description: If luxury THC granola, weed aperitifs and CBD pillows couldn't make me into a stoner, nothing can.

item.title: How Architects Can Stop COVID-19 From Spreading Indoors
item.description: Daylight, natural ventilation and unfinished wood surfaces can all reduce the abundance of harmful pathogens.

item.title: This Is The World's Fastest Production Submarine's Crazy Molten Metal Cooled Reactor
item.description: The reactor used molten lead-bismuth for coolant, which meant it turned into a brick if it stopped circulating, but gave big power for its size.

item.title: Genius Designed A Basketball Hoop Where The Ball Always Goes In
item.description: A YouTuber wrote some software to come up with the most optimal basketball backboard possible and then built it.

item.title: The History Of The Hawaiian Shirt
item.description: From kitsch to cool, ride the waves of undulating popularity of a tropical fashion statement.

item.title: I Asked A Real Car Color Professional Hard-Hitting Questions About Car Color And Here's The Result
item.description: Despite frivolous distractions like this whole "pandemic" and "global economic shutdown" we all know that the real crisis is the Crisis of Boring Car Colors.

item.title: Want A Private Island? You Can Have This One With A Historic Cottage For $1.5M
item.description: The one-acre island comes with a well-preserved historic cottage, dock and sandy beach.
item.kicker: WE WANT TO GO TO THERE

item.title: Why Is 'Cottagecore' Booming?
item.description: The visual and lifestyle movement is designed to fetishize the wholesome purity of the outdoors.

item.title: A Construction Mistake In Rome That Created A Lake And United A Neighborhood
item.description: With no local government able to take control of the situation, an accidental lake became the unexpected catalyst of a community struggle for new ecological and urban imaginations.

item.title: Safe As Houses
item.description: Americans have always designed our living spaces to respond to threats both real and imagined.

item.title: Using No Nails At All, Two Men Build A Survival Shelter From Scratch
item.description: Here's how a shelter in the woods might have been built by frontiersmen in the 18th century.

item.title: Guy Builds A Supersonic Ping Pong Ball Cannon, Blasts A Hole Clean Through Paddle
item.description: This is *not* legal to use in professional table tennis games, but it is pretty dope.

item.title: How To Make A City Livable During Lockdown
item.description: From wider sidewalks to better balconies: tips from a long-time urbanist.

item.title: A Previously Abandoned Airstream's Transformation Is Beautiful
item.description: This creative couple bought an abandoned Airstream on the side of the road for $600, eventually spending two and a half years and $20K to completely renovate it themselves!
item.kicker: BUY IT, BUILD IT, LIVE IT

item.title: The Pandemic Could Be An Opportunity To Remake Cities
item.description: Cities from Bogota to Oakland are closing streets to make room for pedestrians and bikers. Urbanists think we'd be healthier if such changes were permanent.

item.title: Which 3D Printed Bridge Design Can Handle The Most Force From A Hydraulic Press?
item.description:
The Hydraulic Press Channel
held a design competition where viewers designed their own bridge designs. Here's how they fared under immense pressure.

item.title: This Abandoned Site Was Once The 'City Of 1,001 Churches'
item.description: The capital of medieval Armenia, the city of Ani was a thriving center of trade and faith, survived by its haunting ruins.

item.title: The Surreal Sight Of Disinfecting Historic Sites
item.description: Unsung workers around the world on the front lines of the pandemic fight.

item.title: How Infectious Disease Defined The American Bathroom
item.description: Cholera and tuberculosis outbreaks transformed the design and technology of the home bathroom. Will Covid-19 inspire a new wave of hygiene innovation?

item.title: People In Tall Buildings May Be More At Risk
item.description: High-occupancy buildings, like towers and hospitals, could be a hidden risk in the battle against COVID-19.

item.title: This Boy Scout Invented A Solution To One Of Masks' Biggest Problems
item.description: Healthcare professionals wear masks all day. They're not comfortable.

item.title: Why The Tallest Building In China Became A Spectacular Failure
item.description: Shanghai Tower, the second tallest building in the world, was supposed to be a symbol of China's economic success but ended up becoming an albatross.

item.title: A Look Inside Drake's Ridiculous, 50,000-Square-Foot Toronto Mansion
item.description: Measuring 50,000 square feet, the rapper's Toronto home features amenities such as an NBA regulation-size indoor basketball court crowned by a 21-square-foot pyramidal skylight.

item.title: A Fascinating Explanation Of How The Panama Canal's Locks Work
item.description: The technology of canal locks is ancient yet ingenious, and it's especially demonstrable in the design of the Panama Canal.
item.kicker: COME ON IN, THE WATER'S FINE

item.title: Dr. Harvey Karp, The SNOO And The Quest To Solve Bad Sleep
item.description: A high-tech bassinet has revolutionized the market. Will it ever reach the masses?

item.title: The Key Behind Designing Ventilators That Cost Less
item.description: The supply of ventilators is one of the most crucial issues we have to deal with in grappling with the coronavirus pandemic. Here are the challenges engineers face in designing low-cost ventilators.

item.title: How The Most Iconic Arcade Game Fonts Were Designed
item.description: There were a lot of challenges that had to be faced in creating some of the most well-known 8-bit arcade game fonts.

item.title: The Open Floor Plan Fantasy Is About Doing Whatever the Hell You Want
item.description: Every month or so, when boredom strikes, I fantasize about tearing down the wall between the living room and the kitchen in my apartment.

item.title: Watch This Professional Card Stacker Build Impossibly High Skyscrapers Out Of Playing Cards
item.description: The Guinness World Record holder for Tallest House of Cards Bryan Berg explains how he got so good at stacking cards.

item.title: A Peek At Utopian Space Dreams Behind The Iron Curtain
item.description: A new collection of Soviet space design is more relevant than ever.
item.kicker: 'WITHOUT YOUR PAST, YOU CANNOT MOVE ON'

item.title: Finding Beautiful Baby Decor In A Sea Of Plastic
item.description: It turns out there are beautiful things for babies. It's also true that these are, for the most part, the most expensive baby items on the market.

item.title: Why Masks Aren't Better At Protecting Us From Viruses
item.description: In short: bad design.

item.title: Designing An End To A Toxic American Obsession: The Lawn
item.description:
According to environmental scientists, transforming lawns into miniature modular bio-reserves could not only boost biodiversity, but could cut water and petrol consumption and reduce the use of dangerous lawn chemicals.
Yet the question for many homeowners remains: how?

item.title: Take A Look Inside This $40.5 Million San Francisco Mansion Equipped With Its Own 'Batcave'
item.description: If money was no object, or if you happened to be the real Bruce Wayne, this would be the perfect house for you.

item.title: Bronx Science Students Re-Created Their School On Minecraft
item.description: A group of Bronx High School of Science students are reconstructing a virtual campus. They aren't finished yet, but it's clear how much detail has already gone into the product.

item.title: Homes Actually Need To Be Practical Now
item.description: One of the ironies of social distancing is that it can put privacy in short supply.

item.title: The Ethical Failures Of Modern Architecture
item.description: Why do famous architects continue to work with corrupt authoritarians and pernicious corporations?

item.title: Why Did Factory Car Colors Get So Boring?
item.description: The majority of new cars are white, grey, black and/or tan. Why has factory car paint become so drab?

item.title: Damn Your Eyes: The Ugliest Cars Ever Made
item.description: We appreciate good design, but ugly cars are even more entertaining. Here are 30 of the ugliest cars ever made.

item.title: The Genius Engineering Behind Why Modern Sports Stadiums No Longer Have Support Poles
item.description: It's a cumbersome experience, trying to view what's happening in a stadium and not be obstructed by the view of a pole. Here are the architectural tricks employed that helped modern stadiums get rid of these structures.

item.title: Ford's Quickly-Designed Powered Air-Purifying Respirators Are A Clever Re-Use Of F-150 And Hand Tool Parts
item.description: The push to produce more desperately-needed equipment like air purifiers and respirators is leading to some fascinating improvised quick engineering and design solutions.

item.title: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Mercedes G-Wagen
item.description: I never loved the Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG before. But driving the ludicrously-speedy utility vehicle around Scotland changed my mind.
item.kicker: NOT A CAR IN THE WORLD

item.title: The Untold Origin Story Of The N95 Mask
item.description: The most important design object of our time was more than a century in the making.

item.title: Where Did Los Angeles Get Its Retrofuturistic Architecture Style From?
item.description: Take a drive around Los Angeles and you'll see a lot of buildings with sharp angles and kitschy neon lights. Douglas Haskell named it "Googie architecture" and the name stuck. How did the style take off?

item.title: Batman's Comic Book Costumes, Ranked By Influence And Iconic Design
item.description: Taking a look at Batman's 80-plus year history of having the best superhero costume ever, and finding the best of the best.

item.title: The Incredible Engineering Behind Disney World's Magic Mirror
item.description: A lot of design went into crafting this mirror, which transforms from a mirror into a walkable portal for guests.

item.title: How Much Square Footage $500,000 Will Buy You In Every State, Visualized
item.description: If we were currently allowed to do go outside and house-hunt and the economy weren't so precarious, how many square feet would $500,000 buy you?
item.kicker: FACTOR IN AN EXTRA SIX FEET FOR EVERY FOOT

item.title: This Pink Concrete Home Is An Affordable Housing Prototype
item.description: The design is part of a larger exploration of attractive homes for middle — and low — income families.

item.title: These Famous Logos Have Been Remade For The Coronavirus Age
item.description: Slovenia-based creative Jure Tovrljan incorporated "social distancing" and other measures to famous marks.
item.kicker: JUST DO IT, BUT NOT TOGETHER
